education_text.0: Wendy Hall was born in west London and educated at      The Ellen Wilkinson School for Girls Ealing Grammar School for GirlsHall returned to the University of Southampton in 1984 to join the newly formed computer science group there, working in      multimedia and      hypermediaWendy Hall and Hugh Davis led the Multimedia Research Group at the University of Southampton , which created commercial systems near the beginning of the hypertext and database system era, includingWendy Hall and Hugh Davis led the Multimedia Research Group at the University of Southampton , which created commercial systems near the beginning of the hypertext and database system era, includingHall was appointed the university's first female professor of engineering in 1994Hall was appointed the university's first female professor of engineering in 1994In 2017, Hall was appointed Regius Professor of Computer Science at the University of SouthamptonIn 2017, Hall was appointed Regius Professor of Computer Science at the University of SouthamptonHall also has honorary degrees from      Oxford Brookes University Oxford Brookes University,      redirect    Glamorgan University Glamorgan University,      Cardiff University Cardiff University,      Open University of Catalonia Open University of Catalonia          and the      University of Pretoria University of PretoriaShe was one of the 30 women identified in the BCS Women in IT Campaign in 2014          and was featured in the book of these 30 women in IT,   Women in IT
